TÃ¼rkiye will continue to strengthen and maintain its status as a safe haven for international investments and investors.                                                                                                                                                                  We have made TÃ¼rkiye a key country for crisis resolution thanks to our balanced, principled, and reasonable policies.  Throughout every crisis, we have steadfastly advocated for justice, peace, human rights and freedoms.  We have been among the first to engage with the affected parties in all crises, from the war between Russia and Ukraine to the instability in Syria, to the human tragedy in Gaza.  To date, our most significant accomplishment has been averting the involvement of our country in violent conflicts and preventing the spread of instability within our borders.  We have deployed all available resources at our disposal in order to put an end to the bloodshed, wherever it may be.  We never consider the faith or origin of the oppressed while protecting them, as we are fully aware that it is our responsibility to stand firm against the oppressor.  Inshallah, we will continue the same honourable stance from now on.  While taking these steps in foreign policy, we have never put the economy on the back burner.  Without compromising our strategy of fostering national growth through investment, employment, production, exports, and current account surplus, we have formulated, executed, and will continue to execute policies that deliver on current requirements.  To attract foreign direct investments to our country, we will streamline legal procedures pertaining to commerce, financing, and investment.  We will make arrangements in the basic tax laws to establish an investor-friendly, straightforward, easy-to-understand, and fair tax system. President @RTErdogan spoke by phone with Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis of Greece.  Views were exchanged regarding the conflict between Israel and Palestine and numerous concerning developments, particularly the human rights violations in the region.  President ErdoÄŸan stated that TÃ¼rkiye has been exerting all kinds of efforts for this conflict, which may lead to utterly negative consequences regionally and globally, to end, and will continue to do so.  Noting that regional countries should endeavor to end the conflict and human rights violations as well as protecting the peace, and that they should give messages to the world to that effect, President ErdoÄŸan said that it would be right to take steps that would reduce reaction rather than increase them as soon as possible.

President @RTErdogan spoke by phone with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak of the United Kingdom.  The call addressed the current situation in the Israel-Palestine conflict, policies that should be followed in order to restore peace in the region and urgent measures for the resolution of the severe humanitarian crises.  Noting that the international community, the Western countries in particular, should effectively object to the human rights violations in Gaza, President ErdoÄŸan stated that it is important to remember and deliver the unfulfilled promises made to Palestine over the years instead of taking provocative steps that deepen the crisis.

President @RTErdogan spoke by phone with President Seyyed Ebrahim Raisi of Iran.  The call addressed the Israel-Palestine conflict, the mounting tension in the region and the steps that should be taken for the resolution.  Underscoring that the immediate termination of the conflicts is important in the name of regional and global peace, President ErdoÄŸan said that TÃ¼rkiye exerts intensive efforts in order for the humanitarian aid to be delivered to Gaza.  Further stressing that steps that would increase the tension must be avoided, President ErdoÄŸan noted that mutual positive steps can bring about lasting resolution to the Israel-Palestine issue.

I hope that the terminal building and runway of Ercan Airport, which we have inaugurated today, will be auspicious for the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.                                                                                                                           In addition to its direct contribution to tourism, a more modern and spacious terminal building will generate more investment, revenue, and employment.  Ercan Airport currently has the highest passenger capacity of all airports on the island of Cyprus.  This initiative will help establish the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus as a recognized brand in the Eastern Mediterranean, which represents a bastion of stability in the Eastern Mediterranean.  Ercan Airport currently offers direct flights to only TÃ¼rkiye due to the unfair and unlawful practices of the international community.  Ercan Airport provides air traffic services in accordance with International Civil Aviation standards.  The airport serves both domestic and international passengers with advanced technology and Turkish hospitality.  It will not be long before the new terminal and runway, which we have inaugurated today, are used for international flights.  I invite the international community to heed the call of the former UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan, who acknowledged that there is no UN Security Council Resolution to justify the isolation of our Turkish Cypriot brothers and sisters, and to lift these purely political restrictions with no legal basis.  I reiterate my call for support of the ideal of two equal states coexisting on the island of Cyprus, as opposed to dominance, tension, and a culture of conflict.
